issue.title: Experimental cygwin host support
issue.body:
I have built `cargo` targeting MSYS2(cygwin) successfully, and found it needs some patches. This is the tracking issue.

- [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/socket2/pull/568
- [x] https://github.com/GitoxideLabs/gitoxide/pull/1953
- [x] https://github.com/rust-random/getrandom/issues/653
- [x] https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/17262

body:
> Could someone explain that whether it is necessary to call `OPENSSL_thread_stop` if openssl is dynamically linked?

Ref: https://github.com/openssl/openssl/discussions/22831
Ref: https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/12408
Ref: https://github.com/curl/curl/blob/curl-8_13_0/lib/dllmain.c#L45-L81

The function is effectively idempotent and it's supposed to be safe to call it multiple times. If OpenSSL is its own DLL (like in this case) then it calls the function beforehand and if it's a static library then it doesn't. The function should be called at least once per thread to prevent a memory leak. We make a call regardless and I think that was because we don't know if OpenSSL is part of the current module (like whether OpenSSL is its own DLL or part of some other DLL like libcurl or a DLL that contains static libcurl and static openssl).
So, I assume that it's OK to not call this method in my case?

OK, seems that it's an openssl bug: https://github.com/msys2/MSYS2-packages/commit/5c5fb0c4cd314b2a395d0bcdca6b771198331e17

Thank you very much. I'll ask MSYS2 to disable this call for libcurl.

body:
If it is a bug in OpenSSL why wasn't it sent upstream? There are no other reports of it being a problem. Is it possible this is just msys2 specific?

/cc @lazka

https://cygwin.com/pipermail/cygwin/2011-March/194454.html

It's interesting that the patch has been sent to the mailing list of openssl in 2008, but no one replied.

Yeah, we should report this upstream, and once fixed curl likely needs do apply a similar fix.

As to why it's not a problem in cygwin proper, I don't know. It only crashed for us in some cases, so maybe it depends on the usage pattern.

Local patch applied by Cygwin OpenSSL maintainer to test release; see [Test: openssl 3.0.16-2, mingw64-{i686,x86_64}-openssl-3.0.16-2](https://cygwin.com/pipermail/cygwin-announce/2025-May/012341.html) and 
[openssl and libcurl issue with cargo](https://cygwin.com/pipermail/cygwin/2025-May/258203.html)

issue.title: openssl: disable cleanup in DLL_THREAD_DETACH

repository.name: MSYS2-packages
repository.description: Package scripts for Cygwin targets to build under MSYS2.

issue.body:
openssl/cygwin crashes when pthread APIs are called in DllMain:

0  0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
1  0x00000001801619bd in pthread_rwlock_wrlock (rwlock=0x800275ff0)
   at /c/S/msys2-runtime-3.3/src/msys2-runtime/winsup/cygwin/thread.cc:3228
2  0x000000018019905b in _sigfe () at sigfe.s:35
3  0x00000004358490c9 in CRYPTO_THREAD_write_lock () from /usr/bin/msys-crypto-3.dll 4  0x000000043583c414 in init_thread_remove_handlers () from /usr/bin/msys-crypto-3.dll 5  0x000000043583c843 in OPENSSL_thread_stop () from /usr/bin/msys-crypto-3.dll 6  0x000000043583a953 in DllMain () from /usr/bin/msys-crypto-3.dll

It can be reliably reproduced by calling "meson test", which spawns threads for tests.

Something similar was discussed on the cygwin mailing list years ago, and it seems nothing has changed/improved there, and with openssl v3 it always crashes:

https://cygwin.com/pipermail/cygwin/2011-March/194454.html

Let's do what corinna suggested there, skip OPENSSL_thread_stop() under cygwin. This is a hacky workaround, but better to leak things then to crash.

body:
> Yeah, we should report this upstream, and once fixed curl likely needs do apply a similar fix.
> 
> As to why it's not a problem in cygwin proper, I don't know. It only crashed for us in some cases, so maybe it depends on the usage pattern.

I am seeing this same problem in cygwin proper.  It seems like it really shouldn't be trying to run this cleanup function from DllMain on Cygwin, as the pthread stuff has already been shut down by then, and openssl appears to be using a pthread_key_create destructor to do the cleanup anyway (and that would have already been completed by the time DllMain is run)
I think in the name of stability we should consider letting it leak on cygwin. Opinions?

I don't think it actually would leak, openssl seems to use `pthread_key_create` to register a destructor to do the thread-local cleanup there.  I'd just take dllmain.c out of the Cygwin build (Makefile.am and CMakeLists,txt).  I thought about opening a PR doing this.

Yeah, please use the POSIX mechanisms for achieving cleanup on Cygwin.

Trying to do it in DllMain() does not work and wins you a segfault,. (I am doubtful that it could ever be made to work safely)
Would it help if I opened a PR to do this, or is somebody else already on it?

> Would it help if I opened a PR to do this, or is somebody else already on it?

I'm going to defer to @BrianInglis on that as our curl package maintainer.

Just deployed *Cygwin* `curl` 8.14. 
Could someone please install *Cygwin* `curl` 8.14 and *Cygwin* `openssl` test 3.0.16-2 command and `lib...-devel` packages, and rebuild and retest `cargo`, including the outputs from:
```
ls -Ggl /bin/openssl
openssl version
ls -Ggl /bin/curl
curl -V
```
or equivalent, as it did not look like the updated prereqs had been installed and included in the rebuild for the latest test reruns.

I started https://github.com/jeremyd2019/cygwin-rust-bootstrap/actions/runs/15380021864 (the eventual `native_rust` job is going to be what you're interested in).  I don't know if it will just appear to hang or if it will report a SIGSEGV though (SEGV in dllmain means loader lock is held, so deadlock is pretty likely there)
